name: Albert BROWN, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, PHILADELPHIA COUNTY-TRIAL DIVISION APPEAL UNIT; Honorable D. Webster Keogh, Administrative Judge; Honorable Sheila Woods-Skipper, Supervising Judge Criminal Division; Honorable Natasha Lowe, Post Trial Unit Supervisor, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Brown v. Court of Common Pleas

parties: Albert BROWN, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, PHILADELPHIA COUNTY-TRIAL DIVISION APPEAL UNIT; Honorable D. Webster Keogh, Administrative Judge; Honorable Sheila Woods-Skipper, Supervising Judge Criminal Division; Honorable Natasha Lowe, Post Trial Unit Supervisor, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 16th day of May, 2012, the Application for Leave to File Original Process is GRANTED, and the Petition for Writ of Mandamus and/or Extraordinary Relief is DENIED. The Prothonotary is directed to strike the names of the jurists from the caption.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
44 A.3d 652
Albert BROWN, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS, PHILADELPHIA COUNTY-TRIAL DIVISION APPEAL UNIT; Honorable D. Webster Keogh, Administrative Judge; Honorable Sheila Woods-Skipper, Supervising Judge Criminal Division; Honorable Natasha Lowe, Post Trial Unit Supervisor, Respondents.
No. 25 EM 2012.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
May 16, 2012.
